args: I'm sorry to barge in, but weâ€”
And you've brought your whole entourage.\nMy, my. Well, if it's Heinwald you seek,\nyou'll find him in his laboratory.
I'm gonna go ahead and ask for everybody:\nWhy are you in Heinwald's manor?
Oh, sweet little Notte. You have the most\nadorable look of confusion right now,\nwith just a hint of accusation.
Let us make a riddle of the answer,\nshall we? Why do YOU think I'm here?\nGo on, then. Give it your best shot.
Wait, we're doing riddle contests now?\nOh man, okay. Uh...
I guess you always were a big fan of\nriddles, Akasha. Ha ha...ha?
Indeed. What finer labyrinth for the mind?\nWhat more tantalizing depth to plumb\narmed only with the sum of one's wits?
I do hope you'll partake of this one,\ndear prince. Why is it, do you think,\nthat you have discovered me here?
You can think until smoke pours from your\nears, but you'll never find the answer.
For this riddleâ€”like most of those which\ncome from Akasha's twisted mindâ€”\nin fact has no answer.
Nice to see you, Heinwald. Oh, and I'm\nsorry for interrupting your work like this.
Not at allâ€”guests with common sense are\na pleasant change of pace. Why, you even\ndeigned to come in through the door!
Did someone NOT use the door?
Yes, I fear I've been facing something of\nan invasion of late and haven't had a\nmoment's peace.
Today included, as you no doubt noted.
And this invader of yours is...
Let the record show that I DO thank dear\nHeinwald for the hospitality every time I\narrive. I'm not a total boor.
And I'm afraid you're mistaken on one\ncount, Heinwald: My riddle does, in fact,\nhave an answer.
As I've mentioned each passing day of\nlate, I hope you'll take a closer look at\nmy Halloween costume. ...MUCH closer.
Wait, are we still riddling here?\nI am VERY confused.
So, wait. You came over here to show\nHeinwald your Halloween costume?
My, my! Notte's guessed the answer!\nHere, you may have this treat as a prize.
Dude, it's a bat-shaped cookie!\nI'm totally horfin' this sucker down.
Bat cookies to match your vampire\ncostume, is it? How delightful.
They both suit you splendidly, Akasha.
You are far too kind, and I am touched.\nDear Heinwald, I fear, has been a touch\nmore stingy with his praise.
Have I? I think it suits you well.\nYou've captured a certain...ambiance.
An ambiance of something inhuman,\nbut ambiance nevertheless.
That's quite the wicked little compliment.
It is not my intention to be clever.\nI'm simply giving my honest response.
Mmm, I see. Then I shall take it as a\nHeinwaldian compliment, sincerely given.
If that is what you wish to think,\nI'll not stop you.
Now then, {player_name}.\nI assume you needed something?
Yes, actually. I need your help with\na certain matter. You see...
...Serial livestock exsanguination, is it?\nHow very fascinating.
The first incident happened right around\nthe start of Halloween.
A handful of local farmers complained \ntheir goats and cattle were being drained\nof blood in the night.
Human footprints were found at the scene,\nso it appears to be a person doing it,\nbut we don't have a clue who it might be.
Then, a few days ago, a human was\nattacked in the same manner, making the\nsituation increasingly more dire.
How terrible. I hope the victim is all right?
They'll liveâ€”but so long as the perpetrator\nis at large, other people and livestock are\ngoing to be at risk.
That sounds quite dangerous, especially\nconsidering all the seasonal festivities.
Precisely. The locals here dress up in\ncostumes to celebrate, which makes the\nregion a destination for tourists.

All the new people has made it nearly
impossible to track down a suspectâ€”not
to mention increasing the possible pool
of victims.
Will you help us, Heinwald? I want to\nnip this in the bud as fast as possible.
A case of Halloween bloodsucking, eh...?
Why not offer your expertise? It does\nseem to be a case teeming with the sort\nof luscious mysteries you so enjoy.
Regretfully, I must decline on the grounds\nthat your particular case does not interest\nme in the slightest.
So you're fine with people getting turned\ninto flesh raisins?!
Worry not. This isn't the sort of case\nthat comes with a body count.
You speak as though you've already\nsolved it. ...Have you?
It's a meager specimen, as mysteries goâ€”\nto the point that I'd tell you it's safe to\nsimply ignore it entirely.
How can you say that when people have\nalready suffered real harm?
I see no issue. Once Halloween is over,\nthe matter will disappear on its own.
Now, why don't you all get dressed up\nand enjoy the festivities?
*sigh* You really are quite cold at times.\nThese people are asking for your help.
Well then, if Heinwald is unwilling to\nlend himself to the matter, perhaps I\nmight help you in his stead.
Indeed. Mysteries are within my bailiwick\nas well, so I may be of at least some use.
I, for one, would welcome your advice.
We'll take all the help we can get\nif you're willing to lend it.
But of course. Allow me to join you in\nHeinwald's place as we suss out the truth.

To listen to someone more uncanny than a
vampire talk of rooting out the truth... Hah!
Thank goodness THAT particular storm
finally blew itself out of here.
I can only imagine what is to follow.\nAt the very least, it should make for\nan entertaining show...
